result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Albert Barber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "B" Felony], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Consecutive
-Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
-Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
-Court reserves on restitution to be filed within 10 days.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to:

superMiscConds.notes: Not to possess body armour or firearms.

-Defendant to register as a Sex Offender.
-Not to engage in employment involving an occupation or volunteer position that requires work or interaction primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age. Violation will result in a maximum sentence of 10 years in prison.
-No Contact with persons under the age of 18 unless approved by the Agent.
-Participate in Sexual Deviancy Evaluation and any recommended follow through/treatment.
-Provide DNA Sample.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive 
Counts 2 through 7 read-in and dismissed.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due. Consecutive to:

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael E. Nieskes by phone. DF ATTY:  Mark J Gherty DF: Daniel Albert Barber appeared from jail. Court called at 3:02. Includes 14CF86 and 14CF181. Court reviews files. Atty. Gherty updates court as to restitution.  ADA Nieskes agrees to the restitution agreement. Court orders fine of $2500.00, Court Costs of $326.00, Restitution of $43.68, Other costs of $30.37, Victim witness Surcharge of $184.00 and DNA Surcharge of $500.00. Apply bond on file and refund balance to payor.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes  DF ATTY: Mark J Gherty  DF:  Daniel Albert Barber appeared in custody. Case called at 1:13.  Includes 14CF86, 14CF181. Court reviews files and notes differences in statutes between Information and the Plea Questionnaire. Statute number will be corrected in the Plea Questionnaire. DE waives the technical error in the Plea Questionnaire. DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly accepts the amended Plea Questionnaire. Court reads charge and maximum penalty in Count 1 and Count 2 in 14CF86 and Count 1 in 14CF181. Atty. Gherty makes a clarification on PSI. ADA Nieskes makes recommendations. Victims statements. ADA Nieskes states there is a request for restitution. Atty. Gherty. has provided copies of statements of family members, friends and business associates to the Court and to the DA.  Atty. Gherty makes recommendations.  Written statement of DE   read by Atty. Gherty. Recess at 2:47. Recalled at 2:58.  

In 14CF86 Court orders: 
In Count 1- 20 year total sentence. 10 years initial confinement, 10 years extended supervision.
In Count 2- 10 year total sentence.  5 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision consecutive.

In 14CF181 Court orders:
40 years total sentence. 30 years initial confinement, 10 years extended supervision consecutive. 
Conditions of extended supervision;
- DE to register as a sex offender.
- Not to engage in employment involving an occupation or volunteer position that requires
  to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age. Violation will result
  to a maximum sentence of 10 years in prison. 
- No contact with persons under the age of 18 unless approved by the agent. 
- Not to possess body armour or firearms.
- Participate in a sexual deviency evaluation and any recommended follow through/treatment. 
- DNA sample and surcharge
- $2500 fine plus costs for count 1 in 14CF181. 
- Court costs for counts 1 and 2 in 14CF86.
- Child pornography surcharge $500 in count 2 in 14CF86. 
- $43.00 restitution. 

DE is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration.
DE is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Pogram 
Credit for 70 days. Court reserves on restitution to file within 10 days.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY:  Mark J Gherty, DF:  Daniel Albert Barber appeared. Includes 14CF86 and 14CF181. Case called at 11:31 am. There is an agreement. Atty Gherty recites his understanding of the agreement. ADA Nieskes comments. A PSI is requested. Victims rights have been complied with. Court reads charges and maximum penaties to counts 1 (as amended to 948.07(3) - child enticement) & 2 (possession of child pornography) in 14CF86 and count 1 (1st degree sexual assault of child) in 14CF181. DE pleads no contest to Ct 1, as amended to child enticement; 948.07(3) in 14CF86 and to Ct 2; possession of child pornography in 14CF86. Defendant pleads no contest to count 1 in 14CF181. 
DE sworn. Crt informs DE of rights and reviews plea questionaire/waiver of rights form. 
Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives constitutional rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts of record.

Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 (as amended to 948.07(3), child enticement) and guilty in Ct 2 in 14CF86. 
Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF181. 

On motion of the State, Crt reads in and dismisses counts 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7 in 14CF86 for purposes of sentencing and restitution.
On motion of the State, Crt reads in and dismisses counts 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7 in 14CF181 for purposes of sentencing and restitution.

State Exhibit 1 - Court/Atty's review. Court authorizes release of Exhibit #1 to officer and to be preserved, sealed, maintained to/by the Dept of Justice. This is not available to public or any other person absent a court order. Court revokes bail and remands def to the custody of St. Croix County Sheriff. 

Court orders PSI.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Mark J Gherty   DF:  Daniel Albert Barber appeared. Includes status in 14CF86 and 14CF181. **OFF RECORD DISCUSSIONS WITH ATTORNEYS IN CHAMBERS** Cases called at 4:06 p.m. Atty Gherty requests to set for final pre-trial. ADA Nieskes requests Court reserve on ruling at this time. Court sets final pre-trial. If no resolution at final pre-trial a trial date will be set. Court confirms DE's address. Adjourned at 4:08 p.m.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Signed by SRN 8-6-14. c: Attorneys

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Mark J Gherty   DF:  Daniel Albert Barber appeared. Set for oral ruling. Includes 14CF86 and 14CF181. Cases called at 1:05 p.m. Court reviews file and notes motion to suppress. Court grants in part and denies in part. Court grants motion as to any statements after taken into custody. Court denies motion as to interview prior to take into custody. Court notes motion filed by the State for "in camera review" of certain materials. Court will issue decision re: "in camera review" material. ADA Nieskes requests to set for pre-trial and also states Discovery has been provided to Atty Gherty today. Court sets for final status conference. Bond continues in form and amount. Copies of Court's decision as to motion to suppress provided to attorneys.  Status conference scheduled for September 24, 2014 at 04:00 pm.

Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights in 14CF181. Def understands.  Waives reading.  DE pleads not guilty.  Waives speedy trial. Discovery due within 20 days. Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:  Michael E Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Mark J Gherty   DF:  Daniel Albert Barber appeared. Includes status in 14CF86 and preliminary in 14CF181. Cases called at 3:02 p.m. Waiver of preliminary filed by Atty Gherty. Court informs DE of rights to preliminary hearing. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waives preliminary hearing and accepts waiver. Court finds probable cause and binds DE over for trial.  Oral ruling scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 4, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

**BOND AMENDED**
Includes 14CF86 and 14CF181

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, with any minor child or DHS 3/20/05, BAF, JAF, JAW, DTM, BDK, ELS and TSRR or family members.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-DE to have no contact with any minor children.

-Defendant to surrender his passport to Attorney Gherty.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
